## Read the data - GE and others
```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
# load packages
library(quantmod)
library(PerformanceAnalytics)
library(xts)
```
```{r}
# read data
getSymbols("CVA", src = "yahoo")
```
```{r}
head(CVA)
```
```{r}
plot(CVA$CVA.Close)
```
```{r}
plot(window(CVA$CVA.Close, start = "2018-01-01"))
```



```{r}
# monthly return
cva_monthly <- to.monthly(CVA)

# calculate returns
cva_monthly_ret <- Return.calculate(cva_monthly)

# plot monthly returns
plot(cva_monthly_ret$CVA.Adjusted)
```
```{r}
# year, month table
table.CalendarReturns(cva_monthly_ret$CVA.Adjusted)
```

```{r}
mean(cva_monthly_ret$CVA.Adjusted, na.rm = TRUE)
```
```{r}
mean.geometric(cva_monthly_ret$CVA.Adjusted, na.rm = TRUE)
```
```{r}
sd(cva_monthly_ret$CVA.Adjusted, na.rm = TRUE)
```
```{r}
# annualized return mean
Return.annualized(cva_monthly_ret$CVA.Adjusted, scale = 12) # specify scale
```
```{r}
# annulized sd
StdDev.annualized(cva_monthly_ret$CVA.Adjusted)
```
```{r}
# annualized sharpe ratio
ann_sharpe <- Return.annualized(cva_monthly_ret$CVA.Adjusted, scale = 12)/StdDev.annualized(cva_monthly_ret$CVA.Adjusted)
ann_sharpe
```
```{r}
table.AnnualizedReturns(cva_monthly_ret$CVA.Adjusted)
```
```{r}
chart.RollingPerformance(R = cva_monthly_ret$CVA.Adjusted, scale = 12, width = 12, FUN = "Return.annualized")
abline(h = 0.0171)
```
```{r}
chart.RollingPerformance(R = cva_monthly_ret$CVA.Adjusted, scale = 12, width = 12, FUN = "SharpeRatio.annualized")
abline(h = ann_sharpe)
```
```{r}
chart.Histogram(cva_monthly_ret$CVA.Adjusted, methods = c("add.density", "add.normal"))
```
```{r}
# balance risk and skewness
skewness(cva_monthly_ret$CVA.Adjusted)
```
```{r}
kurtosis(cva_monthly_ret$CVA.Adjusted)
```
```{r}
# semi dev
SemiDeviation(Cl(cva_monthly_ret))
```

```{r}
# value at risk
VaR(cva_monthly_ret$CVA.Close, p = 0.05)
```
```{r}
ES(cva_monthly_ret$CVA.Close, p = 0.05)
```
```{r}
cva_monthly_ret_2018 <- window(cva_monthly_ret, start = "2018-01-01", end = "2018-12-31")
chart.Drawdown(cva_monthly_ret_2018$CVA.Close)
```
